intro: Gonostemon acuminatus var. brevicuspis, commonly known as the narrow-cushioned gonostemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying tropical flora.
